Award.AwardTitle: 12th International Conference on Gas-Liquid and Gas-Liquid-Solid Reactor Engineering; New York, NY

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
CBET-1547981
PI: Chin, Kevin

This project will support the participation of U.S. graduate students and postdoctoral fellows at the 12th International Conference on Gas-Liquid and Gas-Liquid-Solid Reactor Engineering, which will be held June 28 to July 1, 2015, in New York, NY. The conference will focus on the special challenges scientists and engineers face in the design and analysis of multiphase chemical reactors, which are essential elements in many chemical processes. The conference, which is part of a series that started in 1992, is an important platform for U.S. researchers to exchange results and findings with their U.S. and international colleagues. This particular event in the series will emphasize multiphase reaction engineering in water and sustainable energy technologies.

The Gas-Liquid-Solid Reactor Engineering conference series focuses on all aspects of fundamentals and engineering of multiphase reactors and processes. Topics that will be covered in the 12th International Conference include multiphase fluid dynamics in chemical reactors, interfacial engineering, gas-liquid and gas-liquid-solid transport, measurement and flow visualization techniques, microreactor systems, and applications in biotechnology, energy, water and environmental systems. In addition to plenary lectures and topical sessions, the conference will organize site visits to nearby chemical plants and research facilities, which will provide graduate students and postdoctoral fellows with an opportunity to see multiphase systems in industrial research and practice.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 12th International Conference on Gas-Liquid & Gas-Liquid-Solid Reactor Engineering (GLS12) was held from June 28 – July 1, 2015 at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan in New York, NY. It was organized jointly by the American Institute of Chemical Engineer’s (AIChE) Center for Energy Initiatives and Columbia University’s Lenfest Center for Sustainable Energy. The conference was co-chaired by: Bing Du, ExxonMobil Research and Engineering; Liang-Shih Fan, The Ohio State University; and Ah-Hyung (Alissa) Park, Columbia University.

The Organizational Committee and Scientific Advisory Committee ensured the success of the conference.

  • Muthanna H. Al-Dahhan, Missouri University of Science and Technology, USA
  • Xiaotao (Tony) Bi, University of British Columbia, Canada
  • Raymond A. Cocco, PSRI Chicago, USA
  • Benjamin Glasser, Rutgers University, USA
  • Yong Kang, Chungnam National University, Korea
  • Raymond Wai Man Lau, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore
  • Bryan A. Patel, ExxonMobil, USA
  • Camille Petit, Imperial College London, UK
  • Joe Powell, Shell Oil Company, USA
  • Ashfaq Shaikh, Eastman Chemical Co., USA
  • Steven X. Song, Chevron Energy Technology Company, USA
  • Chao Zhu, New Jersey Institute of Technology, USA

 

Scientific Advisory Committee

 

  • Jiri Drahos, Institute of Chemical Process Fundamentals, Czech Republic
  • Geoffrey Evans, University of New Castle, Australia
  • Hans Kuipers, Technische Univeriteit Eindhover, Netherlands
  • Faical Larachi, Universite Laval, Canada
  • Tiberiu (Tiby) Leib, The Chemours Company, USA
  • Jinghai Li, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China
  • Arturo Macchi, University of Ottawa, Canada
  • Robert F. Mudde, Delft University of Technology, Netherlands
  • Vivek V. Ranade, National Chemical Laboratory, India
  • Sankaran Sundaresan, Princeton University, USA
  • Madhava Syamlal, National Energy Technology Laboratory, USA
  • Atsushi Tsutsumi, University of Tokyo, Japan
  • Ning Yang, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China

 

GLS12 follows the success of the eleven previous conferences which were held in Columbus, OH, USA (1992), Cambridge, UK (1995), Kanazawa, Japan (1997), Delft, The Netherlands (1999), Melbourne, Australia (2001), Vancouver, Canada (2003), Strasbourg, France (2005), New Delhi, India (2007), Montreal, Canada (2009), Braga, Portugal (2011) and Seoul, South Korea (2013).

The conference brought together 200 attendees, with wide international  representation, who study and use all aspects of fundamentals and engineering found within multiphase reactors and processes, which are some of the most important and difficult areas for application and practice in industry. These attendees are experts that are both top class academic researchers as well as highly regarded industrial engineers. There were 3 keynote presentations, 120 oral presentations (divided into 20 sessions in 4 parallel tracks), and 50 poster presentations. Additionally, each break between sessions served as a “combined poster session” where oral presenters were asked to give poster presentations alongside the dedicated poster presentations. These extended breaks served as both networking opportunities as well as chances for attendees to view presentations from authors in all the parallel tracks. Featured events included site visits to nearby facilities (functional multiphase reactors and R&D departments) as well as a banquet dinner.

Topics discussed include:

 

  • Multiphase Computational Fluid Dynamics & Multi-Scale Modeling in Chemical Reactors
  • Gas-Liquid and Gas-Liquid-Solid Transport Phenomena
  • Multiphase Interfacial Engineering
  • Reactor Dynamics and Control
  • Scale up and Step skipping for Multiphase Reactors
  • Measurements and Flow Visualization Techniques for Multiphase Systems
  • Process Intensification in Multiphase Reactors
  • Classical Multiphase Reactors: Packed and Trickle Beds, Bubble Columns, Three Phase
  • Slurry and Fluidized Bed Reactors, Stirred Tank Reactors
  • Non-conventional/Innovative Multiphase Reactors and Systems
  • Microreactors and Microsystems
  • Applications of Multiphase Reactors in Energy, Water, and Environmental Technologies
  • Biotechnology for Multiphase Systems

 

Complete information about the conference and access to the conference proceedings can be found on the conference website at http://www.aiche.org/cei/gls12.
